raw_comment: By looking at the graph, I noticed right away that the percentage of ages 15-24 years old are higher than those who are 40 years old. I wonder what this graph would look like if the age groups were different. There is a large difference of what the younger age groups say compared to the older as they both have had different life experiences.  Personally, if you were to ask me my thoughts about the world today compared to someone in an age group a lot older than me the answer would be a lot different. This relates to me and my community because I am within the 15-24 year old age group or the younger generation so I get to see the lives of teenagers change and see how and why they think the world is getting better as the generations continue. A catchy headline is " what is in store for the future"
ace_sentences: I noticed that the percentage for the age group 15-24 years is higher than the percentage for the age group 40 years.
I wonder what the graph would look like if the age groups were different.
The younger age groups and the older age groups have different life experiences.
The younger age groups say different things than the older age groups.
If someone asks me about the world today, then my answer depends on the age group of the person.
If the person is much older than me, then the answer is different.
I am in the age group 15-24 years.
I am in the younger generation.
This relates to me and my community.
I see that the lives of teenagers change.
I see how teenagers think about the world.
Teenagers think that the world is getting better.
The headline is: what is in store for the future.
